website_summaries.verdict: A step up from the single bar with multiple grip options.
pros: Supports up to 250 pounds with sturdy steel construction
Non-slip grips with thick padding provide comfort and safety
Users love the five different grip options for many different kinds of exercises
No installation required since it is braced over the door frame
cons: Since it attaches over the door frame, not all door frames and moldings may work with it to keep it stable

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Only Con to list is that I broke a screw via over tightening, and I was missing a washer. Shipping box was smaller than I thought and product was packaged nicely. This pull up bar feels much stronger than a previous flimsy version I had. Grips are tight and I haven't noticed any spinning on them. I was nervous reading other comments about it not fitting on certain doorways. My trim is thicker than normal at around 3.5 inches, but the product fits perfectly snug and safe to use. I attached a picture hoping it helps other when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit on an older doorframe. They should ...
customer_reviews.text: Will not fit on an older doorframe. They should have the max size of the door molding listed in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Jay F.

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy product, but after putting it together
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy product, but after putting it together, I discover it will not fit any doorway in my house. The house is older and the trim around the door frames is thick and wide, so the crossbar that should fit onto the door frame doesn't reach. I'm really bummed--was looking forward to using this.
customer_reviews.author: Charles F. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Does not align with floor or door frame but can be fixed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to put together. But the item that I received was somehow twisted. It is not leveling it self on floor and does not align with the door frame for pull up. There is no place to do adjustment. I will try to do a exchange with amazon' Update: The item is not adjustable. The left and right handelbars are identical. But I switched them in hope to solve the uneven problem and it worked! I hope this can help other buyer who has the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit doorways in standard wood framed homes.
customer_reviews.text: This will not fit a standard American wood door frame. I have standard 2x4 framed walls, with 4" trim around doors, and it fit none of them. The only doors I could conceive of this fitting are 32" wide doors with 3.25" trim or narrower, or steel-framed doors.. Will not fit any doorway narrower than 29". Instructions in box claim it will fit in doorways 24"-32" wide, yet ends of U-shaped bars are 29" apart and must fit within door frame for it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit standard doorways: depth
customer_reviews.text: Product looks fine, I like the idea of it, but I can't find a single door frame with the correct wall depth for this to fit. I can't even give this away to a friend because nobody has walls this thick. I measured at work and nothing. It looks like I'm going to have to try a few 2x4s to add depth to my doorframe. Every doorframe (minus 1/2 of the moulding) is 5.5 to 6.0 inches, while this product is designed for 7.0 inch door frames. With American construction, there's extremely few homes with walls like this. Wish this info would have been included in the metrics, as this is absolutly not "standard".
customer_reviews.author: IceAndSnow

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay on door header
customer_reviews.text: Put together according to instructions. However, when placed in position in the doorway, the part that is supported by the door header barely makes any contact. The slightest downward weight or tug on the handle side causes it to slip off. I tried this on multiple doors in different houses. if the door frame was 3" wider or if the kit included a 3" spacer, it would be secure and would work. As it is now, I have an expensive paper weight. Assembly was smooth but tightening the cap nut with included tool caused bolt to snap. Contacted manufacturer and received parts after return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: SNS

customer_reviews.title: Good, but can cause minor wall damage
customer_reviews.text: Has held up well after months of use and is super easy to use. However, the black plastic bar that sits above the door frame has started to leave an indentation in my drywall! To combat this I've stuck a couple of felt adhesive pads to the side that comes in contact with the wall. I hope that helps prevent any further damage. Additionally, the black foam has created small black marks on my white doorframe. Nothing a little elbow grease can't remove, or paint can't cover. I still give this 4 stars despite these drawbacks -- just be smart about how you're using it and keep an eye out for any marks/indentations.
customer_reviews.author: Ware

customer_reviews.title: pretty versatile
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and they give some ideas for how to use it not just for the basic pullups but also dips (low to the floor), pushups, and situps. I've also been experimenting with bands for various assisted moves and that really helps to make this product shine. It's pretty sturdy when you have it together and the instructions for assembly are easy to follow and it includes it's own tools, so you don't have to have any. The instructions for potential exercises is pretty minimal and could be better and more creative.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fister

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. The one I ordered did not come with an integral piece, but they shipped on to me. I was pleased they did that instead of making me return everything. Something I've noticed with all of these is that they tend to leave a black smudge mark on lighter door frames. I put painter's tape where it hits, but seems like a design flaw of the foam material.
customer_reviews.author: DavinGreen

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't fit normal depth door frames
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during the pandemic, and beggars cannot be choosers. The bar will not stay up on a 5.5" deep door frame. Other reviews have shown similar problems.I had to use 2x4 cut outs to space it enough to be stable. With this change it is usable. Except for the problem mentioned earlier, I like the bar. (I just put it up.)
customer_reviews.author: Rob Anybody

customer_reviews.title: If you don't mind assembly, it's breathtaking, literally!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! It took me quite a while to assemble, given my lack of experience with this sort of this. However, I've been using it now for about a month and it is an absolute beast. It's crazily solid in construction. One of the things that posed a challenge for me during assembly is how precisely and tightly everything fits together. Also, I love the addition of the rock climbing holds. I got this primarily because handgboards for training rock climbing strength are far more expensive, yet far less versatile for workouts. The holds are more juglike than perhaps ideal, but they are pretty thin, allowing for the simulation of much smaller holds. Absolutely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael hammer

customer_reviews.title: Stay away - not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: This product is weak! See the attached picture - the square hole in the foam block rounds out from a very small amount of torque. When I was tightening the thing it gave up almost immediately. My 3 year old niece could have broken this thing loose it is not a matter of over tightening. There should have never been a square hole to carry the carriage bolt in plastic. BAD DESIGN!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: ... a year and a half and have been very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a year and a half and have been very happy with it. When I get to the office I'll put it up in the doorway and when I go in or out I'll do a quick set. It's extremely easy to put up or take down and has been 100% stable so far. I haven't had any problems of any kind yet and given how often I move it around and how much it gets used, I'm impressed by the durability.
customer_reviews.author: D. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5-starts but one of the bolts broke when I was putting it together. Maybe I twisted too hard, but I figured this thing has to support my weight so I want it to be tight! Well, the bolt snapped at the nut. Good thing I had plenty of other bolts that would fit out in my tool box. If you don't have a lot of spare bolts, be careful tighten the bolts they give you too hard. The quality is just okay, but for the price it does what you need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: JNap

customer_reviews.title: Easy abs with this
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily. Hang it someplace you have to go under several times per day and do a quick pair of hanging crunches each time you pass. You’ll have shredded abs before you know it.
customer_reviews.author: John Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-use trainer!
customer_reviews.text: My 11.5 year old son needed some strength training for travel baseball and to meet his middle school P.E. requirements, and I said I would train with him - so I needed something easy and versatile. This is exactly what I was looking for! Super easy to put together and install/uninstall in the doorway. Fit my 32.5 inch wide door that has 3 inch molding (only about 1/2 deep on the top of the door frame) perfectly. Great for sit-ups, push-ups and dips too! Very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D. Bickel

customer_reviews.title: The ikea-like assembly would be forgivable had the product been constructed with better materials. Every screw and bolt
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' 190 and the bar feels unstable.during a workout. Some assembly required is an understatement. The ikea-like assembly would be forgivable had the product been constructed with better materials. Every screw and bolt, the thickness of the material etc is the cheapest possible way they could have produced the bar. ...and to add insult to injury - the black pads marked my door frame after just a few days. I rarely do product reviews - but this bar is so bad, I wanted to warn future customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was nervous but there's no reason to be!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about purchasing one of these bars. I've never used one during my exercise routine and was hesitant to start. I really wasn't sure of the stability and safety of it. Well I had no reason to be nervous. While it's a pain in the butt to store, it works great for exercise! I feel secure on it and it's sturdy. I do put towels between the foam of the bar and the actual door frame to avoid black marks - but that was based off of other users' experiences. Would recommend to those who are looking for an at-home alternative for pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected quality
customer_reviews.text: Best no attach doorway bar ever. Been around equipment half my life and for home use and "in a pinch" this is great. It is unexpectedly THICK tubing and that counts for everything. Un-attaches in seconds. Absolutely no movement as you excercise. Outa the way yet right there sayin lets do this! I 100% recommend this bar.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Dettman

customer_reviews.title: It did not fit my door frame, I had to return it.
customer_reviews.text: You need a certain minimum thickness of door frame beyond the wall. Also, you need to slip a thin piece of metal between the door frame and the wall. So, a wood door frame and a sheet rock wall would work best. I have a metal frame and a cinderblock wall. Not good for this device. Spent a few hours putting together, taking it apart and repacking. Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: P. Friedman

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONE!
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through a few and this one is the cat's pajamas! Pros: Sturdy Versatile Came assembled Cons: Heavy and a little awkward IF you have white door trim the pads will likely leave a little black smudge (I use a washcloth on each side) If your on the fence about the price, go for it. Way better
customer_reviews.author: Mr Zen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful piece of equipment. My son loves it. We have a very old house with wide door trim, it fits over the inside bathroom door we had to replace the door jam it was broke, which meant new trim and we could get it to match closely only shorter, which works to the advantage to using the bar. Sturdy no screw heads came off or, broke and he's 6'6" 210LBS. Works great for him and his needs. We got it for less than a friend of his from a large sports shop, I'm happy with the money savings too.
customer_reviews.author: carolyn b.

customer_reviews.title: it's great, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit my doorway. I saw a post stating it would fit a 36" doorway and it does not. I tried to beef up the padding at the ends to keep it in place with no luck... $25 down the drain and I'll have to buy a different one. When it does work, it's great, sturdy, and has great hand-hold placement, so I can't fault the product. The seller doesn't have dimensions spelled out and the reviews/answers given were incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Liffick

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This fits in the doorway without any issues. I was worried about damage to the door and my son used it a lot and the doorway is fine. It is easy to take down to close the door and put back up when you're ready to use it. It wasn't too bad assembling it. The instructions weren't totally useful but common sense came into play. This product was a personal purchase for myself at the normal retail/list price. I am reviewing it solely because I want to share my experience with other potential customers. I have received no compensation for my review nor do I have any relationship with the seller or manufacturer of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Bloom

customer_reviews.title: The grips are pretty comfortable though
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't trust the construction at all if I was 200+ pounds. Two separate bars are secured in the middle by a single screw that is inserted halfway through the bar's hollow metal tube. The product seems built to fail. If you are a relatively large person, then buy another product. The grips are pretty comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: gooseman8384

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how many crappy versions of essentially the same doorway pull up bar are out there, but this one is a winner. Feels very solid, good weight to the bars and the hardware seems reasonably substantial. All the parts came together well, and overall it was easy to assemble. Has pre-installed foam padding in the proper location to fit my doorway and prevent damage to the trim. All in all this will make a sound improvement to my quarantine gym.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 10 year old son since he asked for it. He has to always work for anything he wants. So after two months of chores, excellent school work and mostly good behavior, his mom said he earned it. I ordered it 4 days ago and it arrived yesterday. I have Prime but with Labor day the few days delay was expected. He put it together but he had guidance on a few items and an adult tightened all the parts. It fits over his door without any issues, it works great, looks durable and he loves it. He is happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hunt

customer_reviews.title: I use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: Goes together easy enough, good quality .... don't tighten anything until it's all loosely assembled. Word of warning.... if your a big person or your door jam is not up to the task, this thing applies a lot of pressure on the woodwork.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Levanti

customer_reviews.title: Trash construction
customer_reviews.text: Basic parts failure. Square-headed carriage bolts drop into square slots to keep them from spinning when the nut is tightened; that's how it's supposed to work, anyway. Factory tolerances are too lenient and that square head just spins inside the square slot on two of these metal pieces, leaving no way to actually tighten the bolt, nor properly remove it. Can't completely assemble it, can't use it. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Geist

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Leaves marks and warps the door frame.
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I've gained a lot of strength from it. 0 pull-ups to 1 set of 10 and then 2 sets of 5-7. Only problem is, the foam padding isn't the greatest, it will leave a mark on your door frame. It will also likely warp it slightly from your body weight. I'm a 180 lb guy, so I'm not huge as far as that goes. Just be aware, the door frame you use this on, WILL NOTICE. assuming you actually use it regularly, of course (Of which I'm guilty of not doing as of late)
customer_reviews.author: Alex M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these because I don’t have the room for full size work out equipment and I also have used a friends before. I got to say this thing is quite nice for its price! Quite sturdy and very easy to use. This worked out perfectly for someone who hasn’t worked out in a while due to injuring my shoulder. It also comes with a little workout schedule for beginners. I recommended this to people that don’t have tons of room for large workout gear. Definitely helps tone you up some if you keep at it. I am 170lbs and it holds up well when I use it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TrustNo1

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have during this lockdown
customer_reviews.text: Got this only because of the lockdown with barely anything else at home to do D: It took about 15 mins or so piece together (not too hard really) I have used it regularly and it feels nice and sturdy!!! I'm about 140 pounds and it doesnt feel like its going to break anytime soon
customer_reviews.author: Alan H.

customer_reviews.title: it has worked really well and I like the product
customer_reviews.text: it has worked really well and I like the product, however the black foam pieces that surround the metal are cheap and the black foam has torn and broken in a few places after only two months of use.
customer_reviews.author: William Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a month
customer_reviews.text: Bolt in middle snapped in half mid pull-up. Bought this about a month ago, used it 2-3x a week. I weigh 150 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit standard doorways as described
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed because this looked like a great, solid pull up bar, but it just doesn’t fit on normal door frames. Like many others have experienced, this thing needs a 3” spacer or it fits on doors at an angle, not flush, and will slip off easily with just a little weight. Assembly was actually pretty straightforward, and the bar is very solid. Just can’t use it. Seems like it’s made for really old style door frames that are really thick. The box says fits standard doorways but it absolutely does not. Has to return, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Has an issue with quality control
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price but a screw was the wrong size. Would probably have given it 5 stars but a roundhead screw that holds the bar was wrong. Either the screw is too small or they tapped the hole too big. This probably means a lot of these are wrong as the screw matches the diagram but is too small for the threads. Will update when I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: Brad K

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My son is 14 and loves this thing. He can easily take it in and out of his doorway and it works exactly as described. No damage on our doorway. My little girls love it too, they scale up the doorway and then try to do pull ups. My 6yo can do three pull-ups and it’s amusing.
customer_reviews.author: PuceEmu

customer_reviews.title: Good despite inevitable shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: Keeping it short, Assembly took some time but was relatively straightforward. Nuts and bolts were not the best quality but worked as long as you didn't overtighten. Very convenient and easy to install, though it accommodates only a narrow range of doorsizes. There was a little give under weight but with the extra structural support of the U grip bar it shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: RainbowUnicornShark

customer_reviews.title: Works great, once you find the right door
customer_reviews.text: Once you find a door to put this on, then it works great. The biggest issue is that the door can't be too wide -- 34" and 36" doors won't work. It also won't work if the molding above the top of the door is too tall -- probably can't be more than about 5" tall.
customer_reviews.author: G. Webster

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with this product. Assembly was going fine right up until I got to the handlebars. The holes do not line up on the right side. The left side all the bolts and nuts went on without a hitch but on the right no matter what I do it does not work. If I put in the button bolts, the acorn nut hole becomes misaligned! If I put in the acorn nut the button bolt hole becomes misaligned! This is not a cheap pull up, it’s ridiculous that something this simple is such a big issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for male 6 foot 192lbs.  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical of this purchase since I had bought one of these about 10 years ago when they were first produced (different brand). I can honestly say that I am impressed with the build quality and could not be happier with the pull up bar. I am 6 foot and 192 lbs and I feel safe using it. I am also impressed by how versatile it is. It allows for not only pull ups, chin ups, and neutral grip pull ups, but also for dips, push-ups, and sit-ups. Worth its price many times over! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pinball and Pizza

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It’s built very well very steardy good price shipped fast came with tools to assemble took only like 10 mins had one of these before love this one also comes with piece for top for your door for it doesn’t fall down as a extra safety feature but I don’t use it cause I use on multiple door ways. But great product
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! Make Sure Your Doorways Are Wide Enough
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Good quality and does what I want it to do. It is a little wide for my doorways and is eating into the door frame a little bit which is a tad annoying. I would be wary of buying it if you know that your door frames are slightly narrow. Also keep in mind that you can only use it on the outside of a doorway because otherwise the item will bump into the door.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Clement

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start working out at home, so I bought a doorway pull up bar. You would think it would be a standard door size. Of course it did not fit in my doorway as it was too short. So now in order to return it I have to take it all apart. Not as advertised. Yes I do have a standard door size, either way why make it short (the bar is supposed to be wider then the door anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Riley B.

customer_reviews.title: I've been trying to do a pull up for 8 ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to do a pull up for 8 years and couldn't. I've had this for less than 2 months before I could do a pull up. I started training using a resistance band and made myself try it every time I walked by it, now I can do a pull up without the band, and I'm still training to do more. Ladies, if anyone Eve tells you that you can't do a pull up, get this and prove them wrong.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: The positive is it hasn't complete broke yet. However, it doesn't seem very sturdy; there is a lot of play in the middle of the center bar. Also, the foam pads that are supposed to protect the doorjamb have fallen apart and made a mess of the doorjamb. In the defense of the pull up bar, I weigh 250.
customer_reviews.author: Metlen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had the exact problem "The bolts won't even screw on all the way because the square hole for the screw doesn't allow the screw to hold tight. Therefore, you're unable to fully tighten the screws." Return it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy construction
customer_reviews.text: This has been THE MOST frustrating thing to put together, and I've put together plenty of IKEA brand furniture in my day. It appears that some of the holes don't properly align in order to allow for secure bolting as instructed. Calling customer service sent me to a voicemail box that didn't beep or have a voicemail message, so no idea if the message got through. This was a horrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Annie M. Noble

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my son. There was some ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son. There was some assembly required, which he struggled with but I think that was more to do with his lack of reading the directions clearly rather than the directions being unclear (he's a teenager and impatient :)). But, since he got it assembled properly, it hasn't left the door frame because he uses it daily. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was an excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This does everything I want it to do: Stay in the doorway while I struggle through daily pull-ups and chin-ups. Grips could be a little softer, but at a certain point they'd start to get too bulky to grab, so I'm not complaining. Assembly took me less than 5 minutes, but I'm used to building things. It was an excellent product for the money. Much cheaper than the gym and still a good workout.
customer_reviews.author: J Bruhns

customer_reviews.title: I fell off of it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey everyone, it’s a good product but yes the thing failed and I landed on my back (busted the doorframe). Since then, I’ve bought a freestanding one (much safer). Luckily, I was fine...do a search for a video of “pull-up bar fail”...yes, it really happened to me!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is easy if you've worked with nuts and bolts before
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy if you've worked with nuts and bolts before, wrench included does the job but your own ratchet will make it go a little faster. Once put together it's a solid piece and goes on the door frame simply. It comes with a "safety clip" that is meant to wedge between the door casing and the wall to prevent slippage, but with smooth motion that piece is not necessary. Grips and padded enough. Has 10 hand positions. At 6 foot 3, my knees are within an inch of the floor when my arms are fully extended but I expected that - no fault of the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but be careful of fit
customer_reviews.text: This seems more sturdy and a better deal than the iron gym I used to have. Very easy to assemble - took about 5 minutes and it came with all of the necessary tools. The one thing to look out for is, as others have mentioned, it may not fit in all door frames. I had to go through my house and try it out on 4 or 5 doors before I found on that fit. If this review was helpful, please let me know
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: While I do like to use this
customer_reviews.text: While I do like to use this. I would like it more if it didn’t fall off my door so easily. It’s become dangerous enough that I can’t leave it in my door frame.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Grab it! It's a great workout for your back, core, and arms!
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out the different lengths of the bolts, it went swimmingly! Had every part, it holds together tight, and it works like a charm! If you're looking for a pull-up bar at home and don't want to drill into your wall, this is a great alternative! [Update 3/22/2017: It's still kicking and built like a tank. No marks on the door, no marks on the device.]
customer_reviews.author: Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!!
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy! Just got mine in the mail today and tried to put it together. The bolts won't even screw on all the way because the square hole for the screw doesn't allow the screw to hold tight. Therefore, you're unable to fully tighten the screws. Returning this asap. I would not trust doing pull ups on this cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M.

customer_reviews.title: No worries for this apartment dweller
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous ordering this because I live in an apartment, and I feared damaging the doorways or the sizing being wrong. Everything has fit and worked great! I'm a 200ish lb female. It was easy to assemble, and installs without damage to anything. The biggest struggle I face now is actually completing a pull up.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: One Tiny Complaint
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Use it almost every day. Only complaint was that there was 1 bolt, washer and nut missing. I had to go to the hardware store to find one that'd fit. Don't the the shipper thoroughly checked the parts before shipping. I even looked through the boxes n all it came in to make sure it had not fallen out into the outer box it came in.... but nope, it was definitely missing. Once I got it all together though, been perfect. No problem. Does what it's suppose to... love that I can do pull-ups in the comfort of my own home now. :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit doors. Pain to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to put together. Instructions were not helpful. Last screw would not fit correctly. Does not fit standard door frame. The safety metal key does not hold. It is very weak. I fell a few times testing it. Does not hold weight 155lb.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: A Great Way To Hang Out
customer_reviews.text: Really great for doing some hanging exercises when you don't have access to a bar. It's got such a strong hold on the door too, I never feel it shake or slide. My only suggestion for improvement would be on the padding that contacts the door frame. I only weigh about 155 and it's put some pretty noticeable dents in the frame. Maybe if the padding was thicker, it wouldn't be an issue? That's the only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars though--if you're in the market for a door-frame bar like this, I'd say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Corso

customer_reviews.title: Top-notch build quality
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressed with the build quality of this pull up bar. I've had similar bars in the past, but they always felt cheap and unstable. The metal bars included here are thick and well-machined. The foam grips are top-notch quality and the locking screws give you confidence the whole thing won't fall apart. It feels very stable, and is a bit heavier than it looks (which speaks to its quality). Easy assembly - all tools included.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Deieso

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly... just do your homework.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the coolest thing I own. Took about 20 minutes to assemble, and fit right on my doorway without a problem. Feels extremely strong... I weigh 175 lb and am not nervous about it failing. My Dad gave it a shot and he is close to 200 lbs and again, no problems. There is no way I should be able to have a working pull-up bar for only 30 bucks... this is awesome. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Pull up Goals anyone?  You NEED this bar!
customer_reviews.text: Pull up goals - love having this bar convenient in my door way - I can do pull-ups whenever I want. The grips are perfect and the quality is good for this piece of gym equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cook

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great bar; it's sturdy, intuitive to assemble, and the grips are great. The configuration allows for different grips for pull-ups, chin-ups, etc. It's incredibly easy to hang onto any standard door frame and feels very sturdy. For the great price, I got one for home and one for work. After I got over my fanatic obsession with wanting to do pull-ups (since I never got past 5), I still use it to hang on and stretch out my back.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra couple of bucks. Built well and very versatile. The peg grips create a new challenge and will really come in handle with developing my grip for rock climbing.
customer_reviews.author: BushwickBill

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had something like this before and it worked perfectly (until it broke)
customer_reviews.text: Plus: very solidly built. Huge minus: these do not seem to fit my doorway at all...? Not sure why. I’ve had something like this before and it worked perfectly (until it broke). I was excited about the solid build on this one but it seems to be designed for a much “deeper” doorway.
customer_reviews.author: MARK K

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Screw was not supposed to move and cannot keep it fixed. Dangerous! Terrible quality and don’t have the time to send it back. I thought this was going to be decent but it’s a terrible product, first time I write a complaint. After I emailed them, they send a replacement part for free and now it’s perfect. This is the reason why I changed from 1 star to 3 stars (was really annoying loosing so much time to fixed the problem)
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Yanez-Pagans

customer_reviews.title: Big ups
customer_reviews.text: I got this bar for my boyfriend, and he's been pleased with it. The instructions weren't incredibly clear, but it was easy enough to put together. It only took about ten minutes to set up entirely. It also has a little metal tab to slide over the top of the door jamb for protection. The grip on these are nicely padded and comfortable. There are quite a few different grips you can do, and it has a tiny pamphlet with some exercise suggestions. Overall, very sturdy-feeling and good.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Pull-Up Bar!
customer_reviews.text: I got this pull up bar to fit in the doorway of our bonus room, and it looks and functions well! I weigh about 180 lbs. and it seems to support my weight just find. I think even if you were 250 lbs. this bar would still hold. It doesn't flex in the middle like many bars seem to, and the foam wraps on the ends do a decent job of not damaging the paint on the door frame. I still put some microfiber clothes around the edges just to make sure paint doesn't get damaged. It's cheap, durable and I'm sure it will last a while. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: KraftMatic

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about this fitting my door because I have an older unit, but it fit in one of my doors out of all of them in the place, phew. Love it so far. I use it often and so does my boyfriend, who is 6’6 and 230 pounds and he feels 100% safe using it. My door is 33inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for core exercises.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high expectations for this. Pleasantly surprised. The hardware is very sturdy. I like to rest the stabilizer against the trim at the top of door frame, keeps it from sliding down. I'm 6'1, 180lbs, this supports me and gives a quick, easy workout. Pull and chin-ups, dips, push-ups. Three separate grips for basic exercises - curve, mid, and wide. You could do a closed grip, too, but there's no padding (*as clearly shown in the photo). Lot of bang, not much bucks. Solid.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Workout
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the long screws, parts 13 and 14, should have an allen wrench head on them to make it easier to put on the acorn nut. Especially part 13 was not easy to get through the holes, but I managed.
customer_reviews.author: david martinez

customer_reviews.title: I pulled myself up... a couple of times
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. It seems to hold my 225 lbs butt off the ground. I will say that doing a fully extended pull-up results in my knees barely being off the ground (I am around 6' 4"), but I think that would be the case with most pull-up bars
customer_reviews.author: Man

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. A little confusing to put together but works once assembled
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy once assembled. Rock climb grips too narrow to use for someone w broad shoulders. Overall works and feels stable!
customer_reviews.author: Ice Water

customer_reviews.title: It's relatively easy to assemble and multi-functional
customer_reviews.text: It's relatively easy to assemble and multi-functional. In addition to doing pull ups it can also be used for tricep dips or pushups. The shipping was super fast. Reading the other reviews I was hesitant to buy since it might not fit the wooden doorways but it fit perfectly. I'm only around 110 pounds so I can't comment on whether the max weight should be lower than the 250 pounds the product states but for my weight range it feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: axpter

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together but great once done.
customer_reviews.text: I love the bouldering grips, it's sturdy and definitely feels well built. The biggest issue is assembly. It's hard to put together and requires some force.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for pull- ups and push ups and it's done the job well. I am at 205 lbs and it feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: JMGuerrero

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this daily. Hooks easily and stays put. He really likes this easy to use and easy to store piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Empty Hands
customer_reviews.text: 15 minute setup. Strong and secure. I'm in love with the padding. This is my current favorite brand for minimalist home gyms. Unlike some other brands I have trained with, Stamina actually put some design into comfort for the padding. My hands are all types of messed up, and I often train with gloves when doing pull-ups (even on bars with padding). This is the first brand I've encountered where I can do pull-ups glove-free. It feels good to train with empty hands again.
customer_reviews.author: shifu_mantis

customer_reviews.title: It is great!
customer_reviews.text: Knocked a star for the machining. It took some torquing to get it together, but it is sturdy, and does what you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Bull

customer_reviews.title: This one is great. No marks whatsoever on the doorway and is ...
customer_reviews.text: I've hesitated to buy a doorway bar for some time now because I've seen what they do to door frames. This one is great. No marks whatsoever on the doorway and is extremely easy and fast to put up and down. Even if this were a model that attached permanently to a doorway I would STILL like it better than all I have tried. The handles allow for a variety of different exercises and the foam is very dense and doesn't feel cheap or easy to tear.
customer_reviews.author: Binx

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Must assembl every part. About 7 bars in the box and was missing 4 of the screws needed to put together.. Not sure if it works since I had to return it due to missing parts in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Tracyb

customer_reviews.title: Great chin/pull up bar
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday for shoulder stretches. I works best in my door frame with the 2 inch moulding at the top. I live in an old house where most of the top door moulding is 4- 4.5 inches and it wouldn't fit. My doors are 32 inches wide. Solid product and easy to assemble. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this about a month ago and I just ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago and I just did my first pull-up! (I also bought some resistance bands to use with it.) The little metal stabilization clip doesn't work with my moulding, but the bar is stable without it. Make sure you have enough space between your door frame and ceiling for the top piece to fit!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Rock hold pull ups!
customer_reviews.text: Love this pull up bar and the fact that it has rock climbing holds. Wish the door pads were more durable... broke down very quickly. Have to buy foam padding and make my own.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Vandervort

customer_reviews.title: Solid Doorway Trainer
customer_reviews.text: So solidly built! Also, unlike other doorway trainers, this one is built with care to make sure you don't harm your doorframe. All the screws that would touch your doorframe are nicely recessed, and all the other parts that make contact with your door are nicely padded. I've done hundreds of pull-ups with mine and neither my door nor the Trainer show any signs of use. This thing is solid! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: Works great on the doorway and don't worry about it taking ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the doorway and don't worry about it taking your frame down, it won't. I had trouble putting it together, but I fell great getting right. I like it for my purpose. I use it to stretch my back and therefore I use it to hang on. I've had back troubles for years so I have to do daily maintenance else the pain creeps back. Its strong enough for me and the hubby.
customer_reviews.author: Dodson Farm

customer_reviews.title: easy to put up and stable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to train for a spartan race. It is easy to install and take down if needed. I am not a tall person, so I am able to hang from it. It easily holds my weight.
customer_reviews.author: jflo

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: One of the climbing grips was already broken out of the box. Questionable material quality.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Better for non-pull-up exercises
customer_reviews.text: It's a great pull-up bar, I just find it better for push-ups and sit-ups because it has the added functionality. Super easy to assemble (took like ten-minutes).
customer_reviews.author: samuel kim

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Be aware this is hard to fit in doorways. It would not fit in a standard doorway. We kept it because it would have been difficult to take apart and ship back. I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: demskifam

customer_reviews.title: so this is not a good location for plastic vulnerable to random manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: There was some problem bolting the metal piece into the plastic bar that goes over the doorjamb. Unfortunately all the weight hangs on those two bolts, so this is not a good location for plastic vulnerable to random manufacturing defect. Also unit is not high enough in typical doorway to do everything you might like, so will be hanging an alternative in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Work Multiple Muscle Groups
customer_reviews.text: Made a decision I was going to master a pull up and with Stamina Doorway Trainer Plus I have done it! It took months but I placed it in a doorway I enter numerous times a day and forced myself to try every time. This product is very sturdy, I have seen it hold up to 180 lbs. The great part about it is that many muscle groups can be worked with it. One can do pull ups, push ups, dips, sit ups, knee raises and leg raises for abs, scissor kicks, and windshield wipers.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Must have for home workouts
customer_reviews.text: One of best bars I’ve used. Easily assembled if you’re a diy’fer, leave all nuts loose until you fully piece the product together. Seems to be ideal for wider doorways, the steel may damage narrower doorway frames if contacted directly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Don't Over Tighten the Bolts
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chin-up bar. I've never felt like it was going to slip off the doorway with me on it. I docked one star because one of the bolt-heads sheared during assembly. Fortunately, I had another bolt on hand that fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Low quality. One of the bolts snapped when I accidentally dropped the bar on the floor. (See pics) Would be great product if it weren't for the cheap quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Taleh Aliyev

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Fits pretty much any standard door size and is very sturdy. Easy and fast to put up and down
customer_reviews.author: dc9den

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy bar
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to put together and seems very sturdy, at least for 130lb users. The grip feels good as well, but the door makes squeaky noises when I use it -- let's hope it won't break the door trim.
customer_reviews.author: Lenkov

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T FIT ALL DOORS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it's not designed to work with all standard doors. Perhaps my door jamb & casing around the door is to robust? I suppose I just got a push up & sit up bar instead. Clearly I can't recommend this trainer which is too bad because it seams well constructed & easy to put together if you are good at assembling things.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin

product_meta.title: Stamina Door Gyms
product_meta.description: Prepare to ConquerThe Boulder Fit Doorway Trainer is the ultimate training tool to strengthen and develop your shoulders, back, chest and arms. Unique rock climbing hand holds provide an advanced grip to challenge you during your workout and will ultimately build grip and forearm strength for all your outdoor adventures. Traditional pull-up and chin-ups can also be performed on the doorway trainer, and with multiple grip positions, you can target different muscles.Go from the Ground UpLaying the Boulder Fit Doorway Trainer on the ground allows you to perform sit-ups, push-ups and tricep dips. In fact, the simple assembly, portability and removability of the trainer makes it ideal for anyone with space constraints because you don't have to have any hardware to remove it from the doorframe. As long as you have a standard doorframe, you can harness the power of the StaminaX Boulder Fit Doorway Trainer. Multiple grip positions to build and tone upper body musclesSturdy steel construction Thick foam padding for comfortable grips Unique rock climbing hand holds build grip and forearm strengthSimple assembly, portable, and attaches and removes easily from the doorframe Fits standard doorways
feature_bullets: Multiple (five) grip positions allow you to build and tone upper body muscles
Professional quality, heavy duty training tool supports up to 250 pounds, Sturdy steel construction
Comes with thick padding and non-slip comfort grips, Simple assembly, portable, and attaches and removes easily from the doorframe
Fits standard doorways, Excellent for pull ups, triceps dips, push ups, and sit ups
Requires sturdy doorframe with trim, Assembled Dimensions: 37" x 16" x 11"
Professional quality, heavy duty training tool supports up to 250 pounds
Sturdy steel construction Comes with thick padding and non-slip comfort grips
Simple assembly, portable, and attaches and removes easily from the doorframe
Fits standard doorways Excellent for pull ups, triceps dips, push ups, and sit ups

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
